title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9600.7 - Evaluation criteria
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9600.7 - Evaluation criteria

State Regulations
(a) A
contractor's performance will be evaluated by the authority pursuant to the
following criteria: (1)
management of
project; (2)
quality of
work; (3)
recordkeeping; (4)
subcontracting; (5)
contract changes; (6)
compliance with authority MBE/WBE/LBE
requirements; (7)
compliance with
prevailing wage standards; (8)
recognition of approved apprentice programs; (9)
adherence to safety procedures; and
(10)
fulfillment of work force
requirements. (b) A
marginal or unsatisfactory evaluation in any of the elements of the criteria
set forth in subdivision (a) of this section, may serve as the basis for a
contractor to receive an overall rating of marginal or
unsatisfactory. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
9600.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
